SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description1Txt: THE BELLAGIO CENTER HAD OPERATING EXPENSES OF $5,283,333 SINCE 1959, THE CENTER HAS SERVED AS A RESOURCE FOR FOSTERING DIALOGUE AND COLLABORATIVE PROBLEMS SOLVING FOR DIVERSE PARTICIPANTS AROUND THE WORLD. THE CENTER HOSTS CONVENINGS THAT FOCUS ON TOPICS OF INTERNATIONAL IMPORTANCE, WITH PREFERENCE GIVEN TO CONVENINGS THAT ALIGN WITH THE FOUNDATION'S AREAS OF INTEREST. IN 2022, THE BELLAGIO CENTER FULLY REOPENED WITH STRICT COVID-19 SAFETY PROTOCOLS IN PLACE. IN 2022, THE BELLAGIO CENTER HOSTED 40 CONVENINGS AND 102 RESIDENTS WITH A TOTAL ANNUAL HEADCOUNT OF 920 PARTICIPANTS ACROSS BOTH PROGRAMS. OF THESE PARTICIPANTS 38% WERE FROM THE UNITED STATES, AND 62% WERE FROM COUNTRIES OUTSIDE OF THE UNITED STATES. SEE STATEMENT 26 FOR A SCHEDULE OF CONFERENCES AND RESIDENCIES HELD AT BELLAGIO IN 2022.
SummaryOfDirectChrtblActyGrp.Description2Txt: SMART POWER FOR RURAL DEVELOPMENT INDIA FOUNDATION ("SPI"): TO PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO DEVELOPERS AND HELP EXPAND THE FIELD OF OFFGRID RENEWABLE ENERGY TO RURAL VILLAGES IN INDIA TO IMPROVE THE LIVES AND LIVELIHOODS OF POOR AND VULNERABLE PEOPLE VIA MINI-GRIDS AND ROOF-TOP SOLAR FOR SMALL ENTERPRISES. SUPPORT TO DEVELOPERS INCLUDES PROVIDING THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR FREE ON SITE SELECTION, DEMAND/CUSTOMER ACQUISITION, LOCAL ENTERPRISE PROMOTION, AND LOCAL ENERGY SYSTEM DESIGN. THE PARTNER DEVELOPERS PROVIDE OPERATION, MANAGEMENT, PROCUREMENT, AND CREDITORS TO THE PROJECT. RF PROVIDES THE FUNDING TO LOCAL DEVELOPERS FOR UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.

(A) THE FOUNDATION DID NOT ACCEPT UNSOLICITED INQUIRIES IN 2022 EXCEPT FOR APPLICANTS TO THE BELLAGIO CENTER, ITALY.(B) APPLICANTS TO THE BELLAGIO CENTER, ITALY, ARE ASKED TO APPLY ON LINE AT WWW.ROCKEFELLERFOUNDATION.ORG.(C) IN 2022, THERE WERE NO SPECIFIC SUBMISSION DEADLINES FOR THE FOUNDATION'S PROGRAMS, OTHER THAN FOR THE BELLAGIO PROGRAM. IN ADDITION, FROM TIME TO TIME, REQUESTS FOR PROPOSALS WERE SENT OUT WITH SPECIFIC DEADLINES TO A SELECT GROUP OF PROSPECTIVE GRANTEES FOR PARTICULAR PROJECTS.(D) THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION DEVELOPS ITS PROGRAMS, STRATEGIES AND APPROACHES DESIGNED TO HAVE AN IMPACT ON A PARTICULAR SET OF ISSUES OR CHALLENGES THROUGH A CONSULTATIVE AND COLLABORATIVE PROCESS. WE ENGAGE A VARIETY OF GROUPS, INCLUDING SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS, POLICYMAKERS AND REPRESENTATIVES OF APPLICABLE COMMUNITIES TO FULLY UNDERSTAND A GIVEN CHALLENGE OR OPPORTUNITY, INCLUDING THE ECONOMIC, POLITICAL OR SOCIAL CONTEXT IN WHICH IT RESIDES. IN THE COURSE OF PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, THE FOUNDATION IDENTIFIES AND CONSIDERS ORGANIZATIONS THAT WE BELIEVE ARE BEST POSITIONED TO IMPLEMENT DEFINED COMPONENTS OF A PROGRAM. THIS PROCESS HELPS DETERMINE THE ORGANIZATIONS TO WHICH THE FOUNDATION WILL PROVIDE GRANTS, AND WE WILL THEN REQUEST PROJECT PROPOSALS FROM THOSE ORGANIZATIONS. IN ORDER TO FOCUS AND MAXIMIZE THE IMPACT OF OUR GRANTMAKING, WE RARELY PROVIDE FUNDING IN RESPONSE TO UNSOLICITED PROPOSALS. AS A MATTER OF POLICY, THE FOUNDATION DOES NOT GIVE OR LEND MONEY FOR PERSONAL AID TO INDIVIDUALS OR, EXCEPT IN RARE CASES, FUND ENDOWMENTS, OR CONTRIBUTE TO BUILDING AND OPERATING FUNDS.DURING 2022, THE ROCKEFELLER FOUNDATION PURSUED ITS 1913 MISSION OF PROMOTING THE WELL-BEING OF HUMANITY THROUGHOUT THE WORLD BY BUILDING COLLABORATIVE PARTNERSHIPS AT THE FRONTIERS OF SCIENCE, TECHNOLOGY, AND INNOVATION TO ENABLE INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES, AND COMMUNITIES TO FLOURISH. THE FOUNDATION WORKS TO PROMOTE THE WELL-BEING OF HUMANITY AND MAKES OPPORTUNITY UNIVERSAL. CURRENT WORK WITHIN THESE INITIATIVES, AS WELL AS AREAS BEING EXPLORED FOR FUTURE INITIATIVES, ARE DESCRIBED ON THE FOUNDATION'S WEBSITE AT WWW.ROCKEFELLERFOUNDATION.ORG, WHICH IS CONTINUALLY UPDATED. ACTIVE WORK DURING 2022 INCLUDED: SCALING RENEWABLE ENERGY FOR ALL, STIMULATING ECONOMIC MOBILITY, AND ENSURING EQUITABLE ACCESS TO HEALTHY AND NUTRITIOUS FOOD.THE FOUNDATION ALSO OPERATES A CONFERENCE AND STUDY PROGRAM AT ITS BELLAGIO CENTER IN ITALY.

GeneralExplanationGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: 990PF, PART VI-B, LINE 5(D) - EXPENDITURE RESPONSIBILITY GRANTS AND PRIS
GeneralExplanationGrp.MediumExplanationTxt: THE FOLLOWING TEXT RELATES TO THE EXPENDITURE RESPONSIBILITY STATEMENT IN RESPONSE TO PART VI-B, LINE 5D. PROSPECTIVE GRANTEES ARE ASKED TO FURNISH INFORMATION IN ORDER TO ENABLE THE FOUNDATION TO DETERMINE WHETHER THEY HAVE RECEIVED A DETERMINATION OF 501(C)(3) STATUS FROM THE U.S. INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE OR MAY BE CONSIDERED THE EQUIVALENT OF A TAX-EXEMPT CHARITY, IF FORMED OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES. PROSPECTIVE GRANTEES WITH RESPECT TO WHOM THE FOUNDATION IS BELIEVED TO HAVE "EXPENDITURE RESPONSIBILITY" OBLIGATIONS ARE INFORMED BY LETTER, BEFORE PAYMENT IS MADE ON A GRANT, OF THE RESPONSIBILITIES IMPOSED UPON THE FOUNDATION AND ITS GRANTEES BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1986, AS AMENDED. EACH GRANTEE MUST AGREE IN WRITING TO THOSE TERMS AND CONDITIONS, INCLUDING THE OBLIGATION TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL AND SUBSTANTIVE REPORTS ON HOW FOUNDATION GRANT FUNDS ARE EXPENDED. THE REPORTS THAT ARE RECEIVED ARE REVIEWED FOR GENERAL ACCURACY, SUFFICIENCY AND COMPLIANCE WITH THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE GRANT. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION IS REQUESTED FROM GRANTEES IN INSTANCES WHERE REPORTS ARE CONSIDERED INADEQUATE. WHERE THE FOUNDATION HAS NOT RECEIVED FINANCIAL OR SUBSTANTIVE REPORTS FROM A GRANTEE WHEN EXPECTED, FOUNDATION STAFF FOLLOW UP IN SEVERAL WAYS, INCLUDING REMINDERS THAT ARE SENT AT MONTHLY INTERVALS AFTER REPORTS ARE EXPECTED AND PERSONAL FOLLOW-UP BY PROGRAM AND GRANTS MANAGEMENT STAFF THROUGH TELEPHONE, MAIL AND E-MAIL.THE STATEMENT LISTS GRANT AND PROGRAM-RELATED INVESTMENT EXPENDITURES WITH RESPECT TO WHICH THE FOUNDATION HAS EXERCISED EXPENDITURE RESPONSIBILITY. WHERE THE GRANTEE'S NAME IS FOLLOWED BY AN ASTERISK (*), THE GRANTEE ORGANIZATION IS EITHER A PRIVATE FOUNDATION, A PRIVATE OPERATING FOUNDATION, OR A FOREIGN PRIVATE-FOUNDATION EQUIVALENT. ALL OTHER GRANTEES ARE NON-501(C)(3) ORGANIZATIONS OR ORGANIZATIONS FOR WHICH THE FOUNDATION HAS NOT MADE A REASONABLE DETERMINATION OF 501(C)(3) EQUIVALENCY STATUS THAT RECEIVED GRANTS FOR CHARITABLE PROJECTS AND MAINTAINED PAYMENTS IN SEGREGATED FUNDS AS REQUIRED BY TREASURY REG. 53.4945-6(C).IF A PARTICULAR GRANT EXPENDITURE IS SHOWN TO HAVE BEEN FULLY EXPENDED BY THE GRANTEE BUT THE FOUNDATION HAS NOT YET RECEIVED ONE OR MORE NARRATIVE REPORTS, THE FOUNDATION WILL REPORT ON THE STATUS OF THE EXPENDITURE ON OUR 2022 990-PF. UNLESS OTHERWISE NOTED, THE REPORTS RECEIVED WERE FOUND TO BE IN ORDER AND TO SHOW THAT THE FUNDS WERE FULLY EXPENDED FOR THE PURPOSE OF THE GRANT.REPORTING STATUS IS AS OF 8/31/2022.

WITH REGARD TO PART XIV SUPPLEMENTARY INFORMATION REFLECTING GRANTS AND CONTRIBUTIONS PAID DURING THE YEAR AND APPROVED FOR FUTURE PAYMENT, ORGANIZATIONS GIVEN THE FOUNDATION STATUS CODE DESIGNATION "PC" (OR PUBLIC CHARITY) INCLUDE U.S. PUBLIC CHARITIES DESCRIBED IN SECTION509(A)(1) OR (2) OF THE CODE AND ORGANIZATIONS BASED OUTSIDE THE U.S. THAT HAVE BEEN FOUND TO BE THE EQUIVALENT OF A U.S. PUBLIC CHARITY.
